issue.title: Fix \yii\filters\RateLimiter

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
| Q             | A
| ------------- | ---
| Is bugfix?    | yes
| New feature?  | no
| Breaks BC?    | no
| Tests pass?   | yes

If `loadAllowance` returns current time, e.g.:
```
function() {
    sleep(10);
    return [100, time()];
}
```
Calculation `($current - $timestamp)` is always < 0, resulting in adding negative number to `$allowance`.

issue.title: RateLimiter produces unexpected result

labels.name: status:ready for adoption
labels.description: Feel free to implement this issue.

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
Hello,

I've got an interesting issue with the RateLimiter today. The yii\filters\RateLimiter checkRateLimit function always throw a TooManyRequestsHttpException.

### What steps will reproduce the problem?
When I remove the (int) typecast, the issue is dissapear.

yii\filters\RateLimiter.php class line 114:
```php
$allowance += (float) (($current - $timestamp) * $limit / $window);
```
instead of this:
```php
$allowance += (int) (($current - $timestamp) * $limit / $window);
// it will produces an unexpected negative number. 
// The expression result above without typecast is correct,
// but after typecast the result will be a negative number.
```
### What is the expected result?
The API should run the correct action.
### What do you get instead?
I've got an unexpected TooManyRequestsHttpException.

### Additional info

| Q                | A
| ---------------- | ---
| Yii version      | 2.0.12
| PHP version      |  7.1.0
| Operating system | Windows 10

body:
I have added rate limter config in our project but didn't get any below parameters in response headers
X-Rate-Limit-Limit
X-Rate-Limit-Remaining
X-Rate-Limit-Reset
Please any one guide me on this. How to implement ratelimiter in yii2.

Check 2 things (as in the guide):
1. Implement RateLimitInterface for your user identity class.
2. Either use rest based controller, or add rate limiter filter in the controller behaviors.

If this not help please ask at the forum.
